messages.content: Who was the president of the Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints in 1920? I want only the name.
President of the Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints in 1920 was Joseph F. Smith.
How did you arrive at that answer?
Joseph F. Smith was the Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints president from October 1901 until November 1918. He was succeeded by Heber J. Grant.
So, if my first question was "Who was the president of the Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints in 1920? I want only the name." what is the correct answer?
Try again, when did Joseph F. Smith die? It is publicly known.
Joseph F. Smith died in November 19, 1918.
